item.title: K add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Those who find ugly meanings in beautiful things are corrupt without being charming. This is a fault. Those who find beautiful meanings in beautiful things are the cultivated. For these there is hope. They are the elect to whom beautiful things mean only Beauty. There is no such thing as a moral or an immoral book. Books are well written, or badly written. That is all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: K add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "The cure for boredom is curiosity. There is no cure for curiosity." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: K add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "A cynic is a man who knows the price of everything, and the value of nothing." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: K add a quote by Bruce Coville
item.description: "All these guys picking on smart kids and calling them geeks and dweebs are going to grow up and want to know why <i>they</i> don't <i>do something</i> about the terrible state the world is in. I can tell you why. By the time they grow up, most of the kids who realy could have changed things are wrecked. " -- Bruce Coville

item.title: K add a quote by Anne Lamott
item.description: "Forgiveness is having given up all hope of having had a better past." -- Anne Lamott

item.title: K add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "The only thing that you absolutely have to know, is the location of the library." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: K add a quote by Jennifer Egan
item.description: "If I had a view like this to look down on every day, I would have the energy and inspiration to conquer the world. The trouble is, when you most need such a view, no one gives it to you." -- Jennifer Egan

item.title: K add a quote by Jennifer Egan
item.description: "and the question is, which one is really â€œyou," -- Jennifer Egan

item.title: K add a quote by Phyllis McGinley
item.description: "A bit of trash now and then is good for the severest reader. It provides the necessary roughage in the literary diet." -- Phyllis McGinley

item.title: K add a quote by Nora Ephron
item.description: "Reading is everything. Reading makes me feel like I've accomplished something, learned something, become a better person. Reading makes me smarter. Reading gives me something to talk about later on. Reading is the unbelievably healthy way my attention deficit disorder medicates itself. Reading is escape, and the opposite of escape; it's a way to make contact with reality after a day of making things up, and it's a way of making contact with someone else's imagination after a day that's all too real. Reading is grist. Reading is bliss." -- Nora Ephron

item.title: K add a quote by George R.R. Martin
item.description: "A reader lives a thousand lives before he dies, said Jojen. The man who never reads lives only one." -- George R.R. Martin

item.title: K add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "This is a good sign, having a broken heart. It means we have tried for something." -- Elizabeth Gilbert

item.title: K add a quote by Abigail Van Buren
item.description: "The best index to a person's character is how he treats people who can't do him any good, and how he treats people who can't fight back." -- Abigail Van Buren
